thread.title: Genie Bouchard pays off Super Bowl bet with date at Nets game
thread.title_full: Genie Bouchard pays off Super Bowl bet with date at Nets game

author: boston.com
title: Genie Bouchard pays off Super Bowl bet with date at Nets game
text:
Genie Bouchard with her blind date, John Goehrke, during the first half of a game between the Brooklyn Nets and Milwaukee Bucks on Wednesday in New York. ‚ÄîFrank Franklin II / AP NEW YORK (AP) ‚Äî Genie Bouchard kept her word after the Atlanta Falcons lost the lead.
The Canadian tennis star and now swimsuit model sat courtside at a Brooklyn Nets game Wednesday night with a fan who asked her for a date on Twitter if the New England Patriots won the Super Bowl.
Bouchard tweeted during the Super Bowl that she knew the Falcons would win. A fan named John Goehrke responded to her by writing ‚Äúif patriots win we go on a date?‚Äù and she responded ‚ÄúSure.‚Äù
@geniebouchard if patriots win we go on a date?
‚Äî TW1 (@punslayintwoods) February 6, 2017
Sure https://t.co/4W763IHkgB
‚Äî Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017
Lesson learned. Never bet against Tom Brady üòá
‚Äî Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017
Omg‚Ä¶last night really happened‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/WVxdKPYV68
‚Äî Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017
The Falcons then blew a 25-point lead as the Patriots rallied to win in overtime and Bouchard agreed to keep her word. In New York for ceremonies tied to the ‚ÄúSports Illustrated‚Äù swimsuit issue, in which she appears, she met Goehrke earlier Wednesday and they sat together for the game against the Bucks, even coming on the court and throwing some souvenir balls into the stands.
Busy day with @si_swimsuit and then tonight‚Ä¶ I'm going on a date üòâ pic.twitter.com/jNF5sokLNx
‚Äî Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 15, 2017
Just met my 'Super Bowl Twitter Date' John üòä On our way to the @BrooklynNets game! @punslayintwoods pic.twitter.com/DHRgY46smd
‚Äî Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 16, 2017
Hey @BrooklynNets @barclayscenter pic.twitter.com/4F5t3wN0fE
‚Äî Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 16, 2017
